title: Paper vs. Plastic Straws: Is Paper Really Better for the Environment ...
body: Plastic straws (which are single-use items) become a large problem for the environment after they are thrown away. The USA alone uses over 390 million plastic straws each day (Source: New York Times), and most of those end up either in landfills or polluting the environment. Plastic straws create a huge problem when they are improperly disposed.
readable_content:
- Hugh (2019-07-09): In conclusion, just because some restaurants have switched over to paper straws, doesn’t mean that you should use them. It’s clear that paper straws are still harmful to the environment, even if plastic straws are more harmful.

In the end, paper straws still have large environmental consequences, and are definitely not eco-friendly. For the most part, they are still a single-use waste item.

So, what can you do to mitigate your environmental footprint?

The easiest way to reduce your environmental impact (in regards to straws) is to refuse all straws altogether.

Make sure that whenever you go to restaurants, you request a drink without the straw. Restaurants usually give out straws automatically with your drink, so it’s important that you ask before you order.
summary:
The sentiment of the text is advocating for the refusal of straws altogether and suggesting that it's important to ask for drinks without straws in order to reduce environmental impact. The overall sentiment is environmentally conscious and promoting sustainability.
